bibl.title: Letter from William L. Lazear to Charlotte C. Lazear, January 24, 1867

div1.p: William Lazear announces the death of his mother and the upcoming funeral.

div1.head: Letter from William L. Lazear to Charlotte C. Lazear, January 24, 1867
div1.opener:
Waynesburg Jany 24 1867
9 oclock P M
My Dear Wife
div1.p:
By this time you have probably
read the dispatch that our dear Mother is
no more- Her death is a sad blow
to us all- It falls very heavy on our dear
Father and Sister. May God help us to be
submissive to His will - may this affliction
be blessed to our good and to our growth in grace
Let us try so to live that we may be as well
prepared to meet death as our dear Mother was

-For the forty eight hours just before her death
Mother was exceedingly nervous and restless
The efforts of the Doctors to quiet this were unending

-She appeared to give away from exhaustion
-became too weak to notice anything - fell
asleep and passed away very quietly-
She breathed her last about half past four o'clock
this afternoon.-

She was flighty since we came here,
and in fact was not in her right mind from
the time she was taken up stairs - near six
weeks ago.-

A Funeral sermon will be preached and
the funeral take place on next Sunday-

May God watch over and protect you all as
well as
div1.closer:
Your Devoted Husband Get Mr Kingsland to leave (and pay for) the
enclosed notice at "Sun" office - Ask him
to buy six copies of the Sun containing the notices
and send one to Father
